text:
“Why, Mr. Razumihin, I do believe you’d let anybody beat you,” Raskolnikov said.

“Beat? Me? I’d twist his nose off!” Razumihin replied.

“I shall not come, Razumihin.” Raskolnikov turned away.

“I bet you will!” Razumihin shouted. “Stay! Is Zametov in there?”

“Yes.”

“Did you see him?”

“Yes.”

“Talked to him?”

“Yes.”

“Confound you, don’t tell me then! Remember Potchinkov’s house, 47, Babushkin’s flat!”

Raskolnikov walked on, turning into Sadovy Street. 

Razumihin thought, “He talked sensibly, but madmen do too.” 

“Ach, what a blunder! I can’t let him go alone.” 

He ran back but found no trace of Raskolnikov. 

With a curse, he hurried to question Zametov. 

Raskolnikov stood at X—— Bridge, lost in thought.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov's interactions with Razumihin reveal his troubled state and the concern of his friend for his well-being.
